page.title: 05Farming,Firs Farm
page.content: Firs Farm is some 500 acres,farmed by a tenant for institutional owners. In 1965 the farm had 70 acres of wheat 99 acres ley,255 acres barley.It grew Brussels Sprouts,potatoes and kept 12,000 battery hens, sheep and cattle. In 1985,340 acres are wheat, 100 acres are rape, 60 acres barley with 2 acres grass for domestic use (horse).None of the original farm buildings remain except the stables-new corrugated grain stores replacing the brick and red pan-tiled buildings. The farm today uses 4 main tractors and 4 others for operations such as lifting, 1 crawler tractor and 1 combine, has no additional employees except a lorry driver transporing grain from this farm and others under contract.
